question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be careful to ensure that the code you generate can be executed and displayed. Create an online video puzzle generator where users can select multiple images, set the order and duration of each image in the video, add transition effects, choose background music, and export as a video file. Provide a real-time preview feature.

checklist.title: Is the image selection and management system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code allows users to select multiple images from their device, add them to a working area, reorder them, and manage them (delete, duplicate). Check if there's proper validation for file formats (JPG, PNG, WebP, etc.) and size limitations. Score 0 if no image selection is implemented, 5 if basic selection exists but lacks management features, and 10 if complete with drag-and-drop reordering and thumbnail previews.

checklist.title: Is the timeline and duration control system properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether users can set precise durations for each image, adjust the order in a visual timeline interface, and see visual representations of image durations. Check if time markers and timeline scrubbing are implemented. Deduct 5 points if only basic duration input fields exist without visual timeline representation, and 3 points if timeline navigation lacks scrubbing functionality. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are transition effects properly implemented with previews?
checklist.description: Check whether the code provides a variety of transition effects (fade, slide, zoom, etc.) between images with real-time previews. Each transition should be customizable in terms of duration and parameters. Evaluate if transitions render smoothly in the preview. Deduct 5 points if fewer than 5 transition types are available, and 3 points if transitions appear choppy in preview. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the background music selection and audio control system functional?
checklist.description: Assess if users can upload audio files or select from a library, adjust volume levels, trim audio length to match video duration, and synchronize with the video timeline. Check for audio visualization during preview. Deduct 5 points if audio trimming isn't supported, and 3 points if volume control is missing. Award full 10 points only if audio waveform visualization and precise timing control are implemented.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as unsupported file formats, oversized images/audio, browser compatibility issues, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AI-assisted auto-trimming based on image content 2. Smart transitions that analyze image content 3. Text overlay and captioning tools 4. Motion effects for still images). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple preview players running simultaneously) 2. Function modules unrelated to video puzzle creation (e.g., a built-in social sharing system) 3. Resource-intensive effects that affect performance (e.g., unnecessary real-time video processing during editing). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating media processing/UI/export logic), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size â‰¥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Preview rendering starts within 500ms of changes 2) UI remains responsive during video processing 3) Clear visual feedback during export process with progress indicators. Deduct 5 points for laggy timeline scrubbing, 3 points for delayed preview updates after parameter changes, and 5 points for export functions without progress indicators. The full score is 10 points.
